pirator requires a fit factor of 100 to

We do not advocate use of this res-

jectively we did not find the work of

When made by naive users, this mask

Emerging Infectious Diseases • www.cdc.gov/eid • Vol. 12, No. 6, June 2006 1033
Figure. Prototype mask: A) Side view, B) Face side. This mask consisted of 1 outer layer
72 cm) rolled and cut as in panel B with 8 inner layers (<
(against the face). The nose slit was first placed over the bridge of the nose, and the roll
was tied below the back of the neck. The area around the nose was adjusted to eliminate
any leakage. If the seal was not tight, it was adjusted by adding extra material under the
roll between the cheek and nose and/or pushing the rolled fabric above or below the
cheekbone. Tie b was tied over the head. A cloth extension was added if tie b was too
short. Finally tie c was tied behind the head. The mask was then fit tested.
